title: How Earthquakes Destroy Houses
description: A fast breakdown of How Earthquakes Destroy Houses for builders.

hook.text: Most earthquake damage comes not from shaking but from houses sliding off foundations. The fix costs under $5,000.

buildup.text: Older homes sit on foundations by gravity aloneâ€”the wooden frame rests on concrete without any physical connection.

discovery.text: Seismic retrofitting bolts the sill plate to the concrete foundation. Plywood bracing reinforces the cripple walls.

twist.text: Unreinforced brick and stone is the deadliest building type in quakes. Bricks have no tensile strengthâ€”they crumble.

climax.text: Cities like San Francisco now mandate soft-story retrofits for older apartments, preventing collapses in future quakes.
